[File: state-sync/storage-service/server/src/error.rs] [Integration: Subscription] [Overwrite Attack] Can the InvalidRequest on subscription overwrite (line 392-401) be used to detect and interfere with other peers' active subscriptions by probing indices? (Medium)

[File: state-sync/storage-service/server/src/error.rs] [Math: Storage Module] [Version Arithmetic] In storage.rs, do the checked_sub and checked_add operations that return UnexpectedErrorEncountered on overflow properly prevent all integer overflow attacks in version calculations? (High)

[File: state-sync/storage-service/server/src/error.rs] [Math: Storage Module] [Range Calculations] Can malicious peers provide edge-case version ranges that cause arithmetic overflow when calculating data ranges, despite the overflow checks? (High)

[File: state-sync/storage-service/server/src/error.rs] [Math: Subscription] [Chunk Size] Can chunk size calculations in subscription.rs overflow when computing num_versions_to_fetch, and would this be properly caught as UnexpectedErrorEncountered? (Medium)

[File: state-sync/storage-service/server/src/error.rs] [State Sync: Error Confusion] [Sync Failure] Can a malicious peer deliberately trigger specific error types to cause honest peers to fail state synchronization by misinterpreting error responses? (High)

[File: state-sync/storage-service/server/src/error.rs] [State Sync: Error Confusion] [Split View] Could inconsistent error handling across different validators create divergent views of data availability, leading to synchronization failures? (High)

[File: state-sync/storage-service/server/src/error.rs] [State Sync: Error Confusion] [Starvation] Can repeated errors (even properly rate-limited) prevent new nodes from successfully completing initial state sync, creating a network partition? (High)

[File: state-sync/storage-service/server/src/error.rs] [Concurrency: DashMap] [Race Conditions] Can concurrent access to unhealthy_peer_states in the moderator create race conditions where errors from different threads classify peer behavior inconsistently? (Medium)

[File: state-sync/storage-service/server/src/error.rs] [Concurrency: Arc] [Reference Counting] Can error handling paths that clone error messages repeatedly under high load cause memory pressure through Arc/String allocations? (Low)

[File: state-sync/storage-service/server/src/error.rs] [Concurrency: Channels] [Error Propagation] If errors are sent through async channels, can channel saturation or failures cause error information loss or delayed error handling? (Medium)

[File: state-sync/storage-service/server/src/error.rs] [Content: All Variants] [Format String] Can user-controlled data in error String parameters be used to inject format string attacks in logging or metric systems? (Low)

[File: state-sync/storage-service/server/src/error.rs] [Content: All Variants] [Log Injection] Can malicious error strings containing newlines or special characters inject fake log entries to confuse monitoring or SIEM systems? (Low)

[File: state-sync/storage-service/server/src/error.rs] [Content: All Variants] [Buffer Overflow] Although Rust prevents classic buffer overflows, can extremely long error strings cause stack overflow when formatted or displayed? (Low)

[File: state-sync/storage-service/server/src/error.rs] [Content: All Variants] [Memory Exhaustion] Can attackers trigger error paths with unbounded String growth (e.g., recursive error messages) to exhaust memory? (Medium)

[File: state-sync/storage-service/server/src/error.rs] [Debug: PartialEq/Eq] [Error Comparison] Does implementing PartialEq and Eq on Error enum create any security issues where error comparison could leak information or cause unexpected behavior? (Low)

[File: state-sync/storage-service/server/src/error.rs] [Debug: Clone] [Error Cloning] Can the Clone implementation on Error be exploited to amplify error handling costs by forcing repeated cloning of large error strings? (Low)

[File: state-sync/storage-service/server/src/error.rs] [Network: Serialization] [Wire Format] Can the serde serialization of Error types to network peers leak internal implementation details or create deserialization vulnerabilities on the receiving side? (Medium)

[File: state-sync/storage-service/server/src/error.rs] [Network: Error Responses] [Protocol Confusion] Can error responses be crafted to confuse protocol state machines on the client side, causing them to enter invalid states or hang? (Medium)

[File: state-sync/storage-service/server/src/error.rs] [Network: Bandwidth] [Amplification] Can triggering errors with large String payloads create bandwidth amplification where small malicious requests generate large error responses? (Low)
